comments.body: I left this around, to enable users to create experiments using non-default `artifact-location` and any other future customizations for experiment creation flow.

I'm not sure potential future customizations are a great reason. We initially did plan to remove `create_experiment` since it's anyway accessible in the tracking API (duplication of an identical API is confusing) and because the notion of providing a non-default artifact location is anyway a more advanced feature (I don't think we have any examples of this).

I think, there is value to having a clean API to create an experiment with non-default artifact store. The only other way to do this is `mlflow.tracking.fluent.create_experiment` which is super kludge.
Er -- it's `mlflow.tracking.MlflowClient().create_experiment`, right?

ok! that would work. Also I worry that this would be a breaking change, if people are already using `mlflow.create_experiment` (though people are prolly using CLI to do that.

@mateiz : What do you think?
We were initially planning to remove create_experiment, so hopefully @mateiz is still on board with that.

:py:func:`mlflow.set_experiment` sets an experiment as active. If the experiment does not exist,
creates a new experiment. If you do not specify an experiment in :py:func:`mlflow.start_run`, new
runs are launched under this experiment.
